title: jiashi ying’s jewelry series combines 3D printed organic shapes with fabric
description: the fusion of materials allows the jewelry to adapt and move with the wearer. The post jiashi ying’s jewelry series combines 3D printed organic shapes with fabric appeared first on designboom | architecture & design magazine.
author: Jiashi Ying
excerpt: sensory connection is a collection of 3d printed wearable pieces by jiashi ying that explores the relationship between sound and form.
text: Sensory Connection Jewelry series merges sound and formSensory Connection is a collection of 3D printed wearable pieces by jewelry artist Jiashi Ying that explores the relationship between sound and form. The series translates auditory expressions into visual and tactile designs, using CAD modeling to generate fluid, organic shapes.The pieces are produced through 3D printing with PLA and TPU on delicate fabric, allowing for a combination of structural rigidity and flexibility. html:
Sensory Connection Jewelry series merges sound and form

Sensory Connection is a collection of 3D printed wearable pieces by jewelry artist Jiashi Ying that explores the relationship between sound and form. The series translates auditory expressions into visual and tactile designs, using CAD modeling to generate fluid, organic shapes.

The pieces are produced through 3D printing with PLA and TPU on delicate fabric, allowing for a combination of structural rigidity and flexibility. This interaction between materials creates dynamic forms that respond to movement, reflecting the rhythm of sound.


all images courtesy of Jiashi Ying

Jiashi Ying’s 3d printed series models fluid, organic shapes

By integrating multiple sensory elements, Sensory Connection examines how wearable design can serve as a medium for emotional communication and self-reflection. Jewelry artist Jiashi Ying’s collection encourages engagement with sensory perception, highlighting the intersection of technology, materiality, and personal experience.


‘Echos of the Grassland’ necklace, 3D Printed TPU on Organza (Thermoplastic Polyurethane), Sterling Silver


Sensory Connection explores the relationship between sound and form through 3D-printed wearable pieces


‘Goosebumps’ Necklace, Brooches, Hair Pin, Ring, 3D Printed TPU (Thermoplastic Polyurethane), Sterling Silver, Stainless Steel


PLA and TPU materials provide a balance of structural rigidity and flexibility
